PET Exam Portfolio

Master the exam one step at a time

What's an exam portfolio?

An exam portfolio is an easy way to organize your success. It contains things such as information about the exam, tips and tricks you've discovered on your own or found elsewhere, and a record of your progress.

Why should I make one?

In English we like to say "knowing is half the battle". If you open a high quality exam prep book, you will see there is a lot of information about the structure of the exam and even questions to make sure you remember it.

In my experience, both as a teacher and a student, I have whitnessed greater success when students explore this information on their own and record it.

How do I make my exam portfolio?

There are many ways to do this. I reccomend you be a bit creative and do what works for you.

You could begin by making an outline of your exam. Create a word document or use the other half of your vocab book. Use a half or a third of a page for each section. For example, write something like this:

LISTENING

Then halfway down the page write:

PART I

Then on another page PART II and PART III and so on.

In each section you would want to write information, tips, and tricks that you've gathered. You should also record your thoughts and obersvations from exercises and simulations.

Record Keeping

In a seperate document, preferably a spreadsheet (knowing how to make a spreadsheet in 2017 is almost as important as knowing the international language), you should record your exam performance.

You could make rows for each part of the four exams and columns for each simulation. Then record your score in each cell.

This helps you determine where you need to focus your skills and how you are improving.

Graphing your progress is also very motivational. Most students are inspired after visualizing the results of their hard work.
